dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Ten billion dollars in Indian imports by 2025—that's like, a massive pledge from Bezos. But is it even realistic?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ten billion dollars in Indian imports by twenty twenty five-that's like, a massive pledge from Bezos. But is it even realistic?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He also pledged that his company will export $10 billion worth of Made In India goods by 2025.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it was announced at the Microsoft Smbhav summit, and it got a lot of applause. I think he's trying to build goodwill, especially with India being the tenth-largest economy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it was announced at the Microsoft Smbhav summit, and it got a lot of applause. I think he's trying to build goodwill, especially with India being the tenth-largest economy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The newswhich was announced during Amazon Smbhav, a two-day summit aimed at bringing business owners together to hear speeches from Amazon representatives and other major executiveswas met with applause. With the worlds seventh-largest economy as measured by GDP, the goodwill from Bezos toward India is necessary.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But didn't India's antitrust watchdog just launch a probe into companies like Google and Flipkart? The timing feels a little… calculated.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But didn't India's antitrust watchdog just launch a probe into companies like Google and Flipkart? The timing feels a little... calculated.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Indias antitrust watchdog just launched a probe into Amazon and Flipkart for predatory pricing and preferential listing toward its favored brands.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh for sure, but the government's also loosening e-commerce regulations to encourage foreign investment. They want that growth.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh for sure, but the government's also loosening e-commerce regulations to encourage foreign investment. They want that growth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Indian government has also spent the last year tightening its e-commerce regulations toward foreign online retailers, including rules to stop heavy discounting, in a bid to protect domestic competitors.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but then there's that trade organization celebrating in 300 cities against Amazon during his visit. That's not exactly a warm welcome.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but then there's that trade organization celebrating in three hundred cities against Amazon during his visit. That's not exactly a warm welcome.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Further, a trade organization representing millions of small and medium-sized business owners organized protests in 300 cities across the country against Amazon to coincide with the billionaires visit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: True, small business owners are worried. But Bezos is playing the diplomacy game hard—visiting the Taj Mahal, paying respects at Gandhi's memorial…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, small business owners are worried. But Bezos is playing the diplomacy game hard-visiting the Taj Mahal, paying respects at Gandhi's memorial...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He has posted videos on social media of himself paying respects at the Raj Ghat, a memorial dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi in New Delhi, and flying kites with teenagers while in India.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And posting it all on social media. Feels a bit performative, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And posting it all on social media. Feels a bit performative, doesn't it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Maybe, but he did call the 22nd century the "Indian century." That's a bold prediction to win people over.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Maybe, but he did call the twenty second century the Indian century. That's a bold prediction to win people over.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a video posted to Instagram, Bezos ended his Amazon Shbhav speech with two declarations regarding India: I predict that the 21st century is going to be the Indian century.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and then he called for an alliance between India and China? The world's oldest and largest democracies? That part felt… uh, awkward given current tensions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and then he called for an alliance between India and China? The world's oldest and largest democracies? That part felt... uh, awkward given current tensions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In this 21st century, the most important alliance is going to be the alliance between India and the United Statesthe worlds oldest democracy and the worlds largest democracy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that raised some eyebrows. But Modi's pushing for a $6 trillion economy by 2026—Bezos might be aligning with those ambitions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that raised some eyebrows. But Modi's pushing for a six dollars trillion economy by twenty twenty six-Bezos might be aligning with those ambitions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Prime Minister Modi, who is in his second term in office and faces heavy criticism for encouraging discrimination and violence against Muslims living in India, declared in November that he aims to make India a $5 trillion economy by 2024.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Still, no announcement of a meeting with Modi. And Amazon's to comment on the trip specifics. Seems like they're treading carefully.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, no announcement of a meeting with Modi. And Amazon's to comment on the trip specifics. Seems like they're treading carefully.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bezos, the richest man in the world, has not made any announcements about meeting with Prime Minister Narenda Modi. An Amazon spokesperson declined to comment on the specifics of the India trip.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Probably smart, especially with Modi facing criticism over treatment of Muslims. Bezos doesn't wanna step into that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Probably smart, especially with Modi facing criticism over treatment of Muslims. Bezos doesn't wanna step into that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Prime Minister Modi, who is in his second term in office and faces heavy criticism for encouraging discrimination and violence against Muslims living in India, declared in November that he aims to make India a $5 trillion economy by 2024.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So it's all soft power and big promises. I'll believe it when I see those ten billion in imports materialize.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So it's all soft power and big promises. I'll believe it when I see those ten billion in imports materialize.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Fair enough. But you gotta admit, the guy knows how to make a splash.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Fair enough. But you gotta admit, the guy knows how to make a splash.

artist_script:
HostA: Ten billion dollars in Indian imports by 2025—that’s like, a massive pledge from Bezos. But is it even realistic?
HostB: Well, it was announced at the Microsoft Smbhav summit, and it got a lot of applause. I think he’s trying to build goodwill, especially with India being the tenth-largest economy.
HostA: But didn’t India’s antitrust watchdog just launch a probe into companies like Google and Flipkart? The timing feels a little… calculated.
HostB: Oh for sure, but the government’s also loosening e-commerce regulations to encourage foreign investment. They want that growth.
HostA: Yeah, but then there’s that trade organization celebrating in 300 cities against Amazon during his visit. That’s not exactly a warm welcome.
HostB: True, small business owners are worried. But Bezos is playing the diplomacy game hard—visiting the Taj Mahal, paying respects at Gandhi’s memorial…
HostA: And posting it all on social media. Feels a bit performative, doesn’t it?
HostB: Maybe, but he did call the 22nd century the "Indian century." That’s a bold prediction to win people over.
HostA: Right, and then he called for an alliance between India and China? The world’s oldest and largest democracies? That part felt… uh, awkward given current tensions.
HostB: Yeah, that raised some eyebrows. But Modi’s pushing for a $6 trillion economy by 2026—Bezos might be aligning with those ambitions.
HostA: Still, no announcement of a meeting with Modi. And Amazon’s to comment on the trip specifics. Seems like they’re treading carefully.
HostB: Probably smart, especially with Modi facing criticism over treatment of Muslims. Bezos doesn’t wanna step into that.
HostA: So it’s all soft power and big promises. I’ll believe it when I see those ten billion in imports materialize.
HostB: Fair enough. But you gotta admit, the guy knows how to make a splash.
